metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23958 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The browser could have been confused into transferring a screen sharing state into another tab, which would leak unintended information. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 85.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-23958` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 85.0+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 85.0+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 85.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '85.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
